website_summaries.verdict: An effective training tool that's comfortable and convenient –by far the best potty seat available on all fronts for both boys and girls.
pros: Stands out for its realistic design and built-in wipe holder compartment
Even has a realistic sounding flush sound
cons: The removable splash guard is flimsy and has the tendency to fall in the potty bowl

customer_reviews.title: We also store the 4 gal garbage bags that we will use for easy clean-ups
customer_reviews.text: Search for reviews on YouTube. My daughter had a sudden fear of the big potty. (probably the thought of falling in.) This will get her back on track of her potty training journey. The compartment on top doesn’t fit any wipes I could find, but you can lift that and store them in the “water” tank section. We also store the 4 gal garbage bags that we will use for easy clean-ups.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: The perfect boy potty!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect!!! Initially we got a potty that made a lot of noise and lit up and it was too distracting for our son. He just wanted to play with it and not do his business on it. Also, other potties do not have a boy shield that is high enough and that is totally neccisary with a boy. Very happy with this! He is going to be really mad at me for this picture someday 😳.
customer_reviews.author: TheMommyLook

customer_reviews.title: Too small for boys to do 1&2... vs. Joovy Loo
customer_reviews.text: This potty looks fantastic and the flushing is so fun, but I've had to reduce my review score due to the size. My son is 2.5 now, but he's on the skinny side and this potty has been too small for him since before he turned two. The opening just isn't big enough for him to do his business without making a mess. And the splash guard for boys always falls into the potty while he's using it (gross). We just bough the Joovy Loo and the opening is much bigger -- just wish it looked the same as the Summer Infant and made cue flushing sounds :(
customer_reviews.author: Sagra

customer_reviews.title: Only useful for girls, not boys
customer_reviews.text: This comes with a splash guard (for boys) that does not stay on; it falls into the potty. Summer Infant sent a replacement and the replacement part was even worse (and the finish on the replacement didn't match). Without the splash guard, the raised "bump" in the front is still generally too low and most of the time a little boy will end up peeing over the top of it (and all over the floor). The idea behind this product is great, the execution is horrible. For the price, I expected some minimum level of functionality, but was sorely disappointed. Save your money for an alternate product that actually works well.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Poor product
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made so it will easily tip over as baby gets on and off- Clip on slip guard is so poorly attached that baby can easily remove. Flushing does not sound like a toilet at all. Top comes off so baby tries to take this on and off constantly. Would not purchase again and do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Potty for Your Little Ones
customer_reviews.text: My daughter LOVES this potty. The "flushing" sound has really motivated her to potty. Also, It's nice that there is a little spot up top to store wipes. Cleaning is super easy, as the bowl pulls right out. My only complaint is that the lid is not secured very tight, so when my daughter lifts up on the handle instead of down, she usually pulls the whole top off. But that does not effect the quality of the toilet in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Wade Murray

customer_reviews.title: Top comes right off the back and is super cheap. the pee guard pops off super easy ...
customer_reviews.text: Top comes right off the back and is super cheap. the pee guard pops off super easy also. If you want your toddler to take the top off the back part with no way to hold it on then this is great lol. Buy one less than 10 dollars and skip this fancy one
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: This is almost the perfect potty. As other reviews have mentioned the splash ...
customer_reviews.text: This is almost the perfect potty. As other reviews have mentioned the splash gaurd does not stay on. It falls off over and over. When my son sits down, when he moves...all the time, it doesn't stay put. So taking advice from a previous reviewer I super glued it in place and it hasn't budged since. Also that same review mentioned that the only downfall to super gluing was potentially not being able to get that cracks around the splashgaurd completely cleaned. To solve that I caulked around it. So, with a few minor fixes it is now the perfect potty.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley B.

customer_reviews.title: Love the concept but...
customer_reviews.text: My 14 month old is 36 lbs, 3ft tall and this was much too small and didn't look like it would hold his weight for much longer as the seam looked to be opening. Also, the lid wouldn't stay on so if pulled the flush handle the lid would come off. Also not a wide base so if he were to lean to the side it would tip.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Potty success
customer_reviews.text: This is such a cute potty chair. My 15 month old loves his life like potty chair.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Borjon

customer_reviews.title: not satisfied
customer_reviews.text: The seat is very small. Looks like a toilet for your doll. I'm trying my best to train my toddler son but he is uncomfortable seating and does not even pay attention on the flush sounds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too small! Especially for a boy.
customer_reviews.text: The bowl is very small so my 20 month old has a hard time positioning himself so that everything makes it into the toilet. The splash guard is useless bc it is easily knocked down into the toilet. With my first son, we used the fisher price fright potty and had none of these issues. I bought this potty bc it looks like a real toilet and my son likes to copy us. I also knew he would like the handle to pretend flush the toilet. Not worth it. Ordering the other potty now. Wish I could get my money back for this one!
customer_reviews.author: als43

customer_reviews.title: Defective, disappointed
customer_reviews.text: First of all, there were some scuff marks on the toilet, and there was an eyelash on an inner portion of the toilet, both make me think this thing may have been used or at least opened and then returned. Super gross considering what the product is used for and completely unacceptable. Second the seams of the base of the toilet did not come together tightly and I’m not sure if mine alone was defective or it is a defective design. It’s is a cute novelty and I was excited to use it, but it’s going back and I will not be reordering this product or anything from this seller
customer_reviews.author: Karli Parlette

customer_reviews.title: Tip: Line basin with disposable bag for easy clean-up.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this potty for over a month now. My 2-yr old loves it, especially the flushing sounds. It’s also light and portable enough to take on road trips. The plastic is strong and durable, and we’ve been very happy with it. For easy clean-up, line the basin with a grocery bag or 2/4-gallon trash bag you can throw away after each use.
customer_reviews.author: DCTXJenn

customer_reviews.title: Great for 3+ taller potty chair and wipes container is great
customer_reviews.text: This is the best potty so far. I am on my 3rd son, 16, 11 and 3. My 3yo is my hardest to train so far. We have a small Ikea potty and went to buy another, but Ikea is out of so much inventory. Also using potty seats in the bathroom, but he is more afraid of the big potty. This potty from Amazon came through for us, it is taller so it is better for a bigger child and the container for wipes at the top of it is ingenious. Super easy to clean. Hopefully we don't need to use it much longer but it has made it a bit easier
customer_reviews.author: Stacia

customer_reviews.title: Very cute, but lid does not secure
customer_reviews.text: This potty is very cute. I bought this when my daughter was 18 months old. She cries each time I try to put her on it. We have another potty and she likes that one (short froggy potty) but she screams and cries when we try this one. It’s disappointing how much she inexplicably hates it because it is such a cute potty. Hoping she will get over her fear of this one and start using it soon. One very annoying issue is the very top lid is not secured at all, so it comes out very easily. Wish it clicked in and stayed in.
customer_reviews.author: Lessa K

customer_reviews.title: Potty training sucks!
customer_reviews.text: I am having a hard time potty training. But the product is nice. It's easy to put together meaning it's easy to take apart, which is what my kids seem to enjoy doing. They both have maybe peed in the dang things once. The pee guard would probably work if you had kids that would sit down long enough and not get up mid pee to run away. Don't let my potty training mishap detour you from getting this. My boys were both excited the first few days of the potty being in the middle of the living room. Great potty to start training with (big boy potty like mommy and daddy) so good luck on your potty training adventure.
customer_reviews.author: Cathyrine Pili Bjorgo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for boy or girl
customer_reviews.text: Love that this potty resembles the real thing. I also love that it comes with a pee guard for boys. Very easy to assemble and designed for easy cleaning as well. My son loves that it comes with a handle that flushes. My son is 36lbs and in 5t clothing, this potty is the perfect size for him.
customer_reviews.author: L Baker

customer_reviews.title: Nice cute potty daughter likes it
customer_reviews.text: It's working well as it looks like the real potty my only complaints are that I thought the seat locked down so she couldn't get to the bowl she pulls bowl out and spills also the back lid with flusher pops off easy she constantly pulls it apart. but it does work and my daughter who doesn't like pottys only the big toilet can use it independently and it can be kept out of bathroom so I can leave door closed since she's at the play on toilet stage
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Flanigan

customer_reviews.title: Read this. Don’t buy anything from them, seriosuly
customer_reviews.text: they sent us “used item” without any notification. We were so upset and unexpected. I am more sensitive cos its for baby. But i kept an open mind to try it. Once i open, how it was wrapped was like.. it will take 10seconds to do that... And still i moved on to try, it just DOESNT assemble right. Back part does not fit and stand. Chair itself so weak, I don’t think it’s stable or strong enough for baby to use. I am very upset about how they do not care about customers and run this for their own convenience. I don’t trust or appreciate any company working like this unprofessionally. Dont buy anything from them. Seriously
customer_reviews.author: minnie

customer_reviews.title: 👍🏾👍🏾👍🏾👍🏾
customer_reviews.text: if you are interested in buying a potty this is one of the best ones it looks realistic is just the right size my son loves it and believe it or not this will make him or her want to use the potty awesome I also like the fact tha it's has a wipes compartment that is a plus and by the way my babies is only eight months no more stinky pampers thing yes it's very hard to believe👌🏾👌🏾
customer_reviews.author: Phenomenal

customer_reviews.title: Good monkey see, monkey do Potty
customer_reviews.text: Bulky for traveling, but our 2 year old likes the idea that he has his own toilet just like mama and daddy. Only thing I absolutely HATE about this product is the fact that the "splash sheild" for boys always falls off when my son tries to sit. It's annoying cause he will pee and it will fall while he's peeing which then it's everywhere. I'd glue it, but I'd like to be able to use it for my daughter in the future and it will just be in the way. I'd also say it's a little small for my son. When he poops it tends to get on the seat.
customer_reviews.author: Ashes

customer_reviews.title: Thanks! Successful training so far
customer_reviews.text: Successful potty train after only 2 days. I used to use another one and it’s not like our adult toilet. I think the appearance of toilet is very important! Also I compared with other toilet with lid. If you have lid, once you are in emergency time, like your child is almost having poo, you will have an extra step-open the lid, which may make you have accidents and add extra cleanups.
customer_reviews.author: CY

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Little ones starting out.
customer_reviews.text: I started potty training my daughter early on since she seemed interested. She is 10 months old and this is a great size for her. She loves being able to flush the toilet after so uses it. This was easy to put together and it easy to clean off. The top storage area is pretty small and can hold cloth wipes but not a full package of wipes. I just lift up the top of the toilet and put the pack of wipes in there.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Good for potty training
customer_reviews.text: This product is great because it looks like an actual toilet!! Although smaller wipe compartment than expected. You can’t fit a pack of wipes in the top part but if you open the back it fits my daughters wipes and potty bags. Flush is realistic! Only other cons is that there isn’t a pour spout to dump it out but that’s not a huge deal.... AND the toilet seat isn’t like pictured at all. It shows it in the pictures as extending upwards to keep your toddler in place and it barely bumps over in the center. Overall, is helping potty train a ton! My daughter uses it everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Cora

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this product 👌
customer_reviews.text: Autistic child can use this, so can yours. So far this is the best way to get the little one started. I bought one before in play room, and it worked. Now I have another in bed room for night time. It was a nightmare without them. Had to clean and change bed every morning. The smell was unbearable and so much laundry. Recommend this product 110%.
customer_reviews.author: Ethen Den

customer_reviews.title: Pooping has never been more fun
customer_reviews.text: ever wonder what its like to poop simultaneously with your kid? Well order one of these and find out. The top section is perfect for wipes, its a tiny bit smaller than anticipated but overall the construction, the quality of materials and ease of use is great. I love teaching my kid how to poop with easy to use toys.
customer_reviews.author: Benny

customer_reviews.title: It's like they never had a kid
customer_reviews.text: They need a few screws for the lid. My daughter walks off with the top flusher and all so I can't put wipes or treats in the top. It's absolute aggravation. It's like they never had a kid. Also the bottom needs anti slip pads for floors. its slides all over and my daughter was too scared to use for a while. Ultimately, it's still my favorite. Not ugly, really easy for kids to understand it's a their sized version to use. My daughter trained herself with not instruction or forcing. She just sat on pot next to me every time I went and mimicked, then she started to use when she could pull down pants.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Adorable and WORKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my son roughly two years ago. It still works today!! It's insanely cute as it looks just like a regular toilet, makes the flush sound when your kid pulls the lever, and even has a compartment for wipes. It helped my son become potty trained and transition to the regular toilet in now time. Emptying the bowl and cleaning it is really simple. Just lift the lid, remove bowl, empty, and clean. The surface of the bowl allows the poop to come right off as well. Two years later, and now we're using it for our daughter as well!
customer_reviews.author: Borsalino A.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing potty training option
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter is 16 months so we wanted to buy it to start to familiarize her on potty training. The first day we bought it and sat her on her mini toilet, she peed. My wife and I were blown away. It took all of 2 minutes to assemble and it look exactly like a regular toilet, shrunk down to kiddy size. Our daughter loves the added flusher and sound effects. Highly recommend for potty training. The toilet bowl is easily removable for simple cleaning after the deed has been done. Our daughter now gets excited when we ask her if she wants to go use the potty and loves sitting on it.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Works similar to any training potty would, no worse no better. I LOVE the look, my 15 month old knew right away that THIS is a potty, and better yet a HER sized potty! This is exactly what I hoped for so not disappointed. Things that could improve this potty, I wish it had a toilet seat lid, but I knew it didn't. She likes to take off the tank lid so we are always chasing that down. The potty WILL SLIDE if it is on tile or wood flooring. A bathroom mat or rubber mat fixes this but rubber feet would have been nice. Overall I love this training potty and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Awesome potties.
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend these potties to all potty training parents. My daughter was 21 months when I started training her, and 3 months later she is daytime trained. Totally amazing results. I truly believe it’s because they look like real toilets. This helped her understand going in public restrooms too! Parents, if you’re reading this, I did Montessori “potty learning” from 17 months onward, and then Potty Trained her using the “Little Potty Book” method. My daughter really liked the Mr. Rogers potty book. Stock up on paper towels and patience! 👍🏻 And do “dry checks,” where you ask them to check if their underwear is dry. Makes them so happy to report they are dry!
customer_reviews.author: TheEarls

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: My 2.5 year old only uses this because she’s afraid of the normal toilet. I don’t know what I would do without this product. My daughter would still be wearing diapers now if it weren’t for this product. I can’t say enough how much help this product is. Thank you so much for a great product. The only thing I suggest changing is the front should be higher. My daughter sometime pees outside because the front is a bit too low. Please make it higher. The splash guard doesn’t work and keeps falling out. Overall great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy N

customer_reviews.title: This was an awesome Christmas gift.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson for Christmas as he’s at the age where he’s ready to be potty trained. He hated it first and cried when he had to use it. Hen then thought it was just a regular toy and only wanted to play with it. When he finally used it an was rewarded for it he got super excited! We put it in the bathroom so he can see the resemblance of our original toilet in the bathroom. He now is getting used to using it and really loves the flushing sound it makes. I like the wipe container at the top so we can ensure he is cleaned really good.
customer_reviews.author: AvidAmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: Not in use as of yet
customer_reviews.text: got it for my 20 m.o. grandchild. About all she has done so far is get her tools out and pretend to repair it. She has sat on it and looked at her potty training book. Hadn't expected her to use it yet, just wanted her to know it is available, Looks and sounds like the real deal and I am sure it will work when the time comes. Her parents have one also. the storage area leaves much to be desired as it is too small to hold her wipes, but we will find a use for it.
customer_reviews.author: JiminNC

customer_reviews.title: Adorable & functional !
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old daughter loves this potty because it’s her size, it’s so easy to clean she can take the pot out when she’s done and dump it herself then clean it out. There is no suction power, It does move around because of the tile in our bathroom but if you put a bath mat underneath it is better. The little flushing sound is cute. Much easier to potty train with this potty than the regular short one. It’s white and matches well with our bathroom, would highly suggest.
customer_reviews.author: Pen

customer_reviews.title: Would buy this over and over!
customer_reviews.text: This toilet is not only adorable, but also perfect for potty training! It sits higher than the typical seat-potty, and my son seems comfortable on it. The pee guard is a lifesaver and I love that it’s removable. I wouldn’t take this traveling, but only because the little seat pottys that are basically just a base would be a lot less bulky to pack. My son loves the storage function! It’s not the easiest to clean because pee seems to fall beneath the removable bowl and into the frame of the toilet, so I’ve lined it with a pull-up in hopes that it keeps the splash away :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: had poop inside the potty chair!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so disgusted I can't even give it anything but 1 star because we've not used it. I bought it "used" from Amazon. They're always torn up boxes or returns that aren't able to put back in packaging correctly HOWEVER this one was actually used! When we opened the box the smell of poop was so strong and there is dried poop in a ring inside the potty chair!!! Amazon, drop the ball much! This should have been placed in the dumpster not resold!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dede V.Top Contributor: Nail Polish

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little potty!
customer_reviews.text: This little potty is too cute! My guy is 22 months and I really got this to pique his curiosity and get him familiar. He LOVES this thing and was actually successful a few days ago!! It’s the perfect size and seems to be comfortable, as my very busy baby sits still and reads books on it regularly. I’m letting him take control of his exposure, but he seems very happy with it at this point! I’d love it more if the “lid” on the back of the toilet were attached, but I can always use superglue if him constantly removing it gets to me soon haha. It’s adorable when he “flushes”!
customer_reviews.author: D Mixer

customer_reviews.title: would highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Myself and my toddler like this mini potty. My son loves the flushing noise. We are well on our way to potty training. It is easy to clean. Just pour or dump (no pun intended) the contents into the commode and flush. I then can wipe out anything left over with toilet paper and a Clorox antibacterial cleaning wipe. Use...Wipe...Swipe...and Go! The potty was easy to assemble. I give 4 stars only because I don't like that the flusher/plastic top of the potty comes off easily, especially when the potty is picked up or moved.
customer_reviews.author: K. B.

customer_reviews.title: Summer Infant My Size Potty
customer_reviews.text: This potty is the cutest. It comes with the urine guard if you have a boy. ( I have a girl) My daughter is 18 mos. so we will start potty training within the next few weeks. It makes a realistic flushing sound which is also cute. Super easy to assemble. You only need to screw in the little sound part that goes inside the "tank". All in all I really like this potty. Plus when I purchased it was a few bucks cheaper on Amazon than in the big box store. If need be I would repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: CARRINGTON23

customer_reviews.title: Toddler loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this for a couple weeks now and it's great! While we have a cover for the regular toilet my daughter (two and a half) loves having her own little potty. She doesn't have any issues getting the bowl out on her own, so she can empty it into the toilet. It's far sturdier than I thought it would be. She had some trouble with it sliding on the floor at first but she figured out how to sit down without moving it pretty quick. She loves this potty so much sometimes she just uses it as a chair lol Overall, it's an awesome product that I definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Heather SpiersTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Works well, looks cool and my baby likes it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 7 month old baby to slowly start the potty training. After couple days and one sitting in clothing and another without diaper, the third sitting was succesful. Sure thing that 7 month old baby will not tell you that wants poo but he gets used to sitting on the potty and doing his stuff there. I was afraid of finding bigger kids in a house corner doing their stuff when nobody sees. My son knows what the potty is for, especially it looks like one for mommy and daddy. We flush "water" together so he knows this is fun. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Agnieszka T.

customer_reviews.title: Needs the wipe container improvement but everything else is great.
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that is an issue about this is the wipes do not fit. So I had to individually take them out of the white bag and put them in a separate Ziploc bag. Hopefully this will get my daughter to do a number 2. We bought a princess potty and Couldn’t get her to use the potty for number 2. Also wish the back wasn’t easy to remove and was more of a snap on because my daughter likes to remove the back.. Update it’s tight where the legs meet in the front.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: My twin grandsons love these.
customer_reviews.text: Since they come to stay with me on the weekends I thought I would try to get a head start on their potty training. I was extremely happy to see how well they took to these chairs and seemed to be very comfortable with them. In other reviews I had read about the splash guard coming loose so I was prepared with a couple of small pieces of Velcro and haven't had any issues at all and can still easily remove it for cleaning. On the second weekend they couldn't hardly wait to use their new big boy potties after nap and before and after meals.
customer_reviews.author: Jmc7228

customer_reviews.title: Cute with a flaw design for boys
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 4 stars due to the issue we have with a boy. When he potties it hits the elevated piece for a boy but seems to not be sealed well in that area and his underwear get wet and we have to keep a puppy pad under the potty to catch the leaks. Please reassess the design for boys!
customer_reviews.author: Misty Oppenheimer

customer_reviews.title: Replica of adult-sized toilet
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for the grandchildren when visiting and granddaughter has the exact model in pink. The white has some material stains but does not affect functionality. The potty is a good transition for toddlers and children before moving to the adult-sized toilet. The flushing handle teaches young children to flush after using the potty when they do transition to the real toilet. The storage compartment on top will hold flushable wipes but the lid will remain open since it is a small compartment.
customer_reviews.author: tropical-myst

customer_reviews.title: I really liked the idea
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the idea of this potty, i love that it looks like a potty and has the realistic flusher. But there are 2 major design flaws that i could get over so i did have to return it. The pee guard, which is key for boys, just falls off into the potty. I personally did not want to glue it because i want to be able to clean everything. The second thing it the top part of the chair just rests on there. There is no way to click it down, so when my son pretends to flush, it lifts off. It would be nice if it was a little more secure. Great idea, flaw with design.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Davis

customer_reviews.title: Best potty chair!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so cute. It literally looks like a real toilet, haha. We have it setting next to our toilet and everyone brother or dad goes he goes in and sits on it and he went the first time he sat on it!! It’s so cute, then he “flushes” because it has the flusher. I think this toilet is way better than others just in the fact it looks so real. It’s awesome quality!! It has a thing to attach If you have a little boy as a splash guard so the pee doesn’t fly out the front. But 100% recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: I bought it new but came used.
customer_reviews.text: The product is as pictured. My son couldn't stop playing with his potty which is great because now I know he will be easy to potty train. Hopefully *fingers crossed*. I'm only disappointed because it was obviously a used item. It wasn't wrapped in plastic and everything was already assembled... I don't mind because it's easy to clean but why didn't I get the option of picking a new or used product? Amazon never disappoints me but definitely need to take some stars.
customer_reviews.author: D.Evans

customer_reviews.title: Mini toilets are cure
customer_reviews.text: It's funny I even think this thing is adorable but it is! I love the realistic approach to potty training instead of some weird looking potty. I wasn't even finished putting it together when my son sat on it. Every time I flush the toilet he has to flush his too. We are in the first stages in introducing the potty so he isn't using it just yet but it's well manufactured.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute but many design flaws
customer_reviews.text: This is super cute and the flushing sound is adorable. My 2 year old loves having a toilet that looks like mom/dads. BUT as parents, we hate it because it is not easy to empty the contents and keep clean. I get pee on my hands every time I dump it into the main toilet. There is a lip that catches the pee and it goes everywhere when you try to dump it. Horrible design on their part! We have another brand of a toddler toilet and it has a pour spout which makes sense and is much more practical!
customer_reviews.author: Customer name

customer_reviews.title: Adorable get it ASAP
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this when my girl was 9 months old. As soon as she started walking at 1 year old I started taking her to the bathroom with me and just letting her sit on her potty. She’s now 13 months and has pottied in this toilet each day this week! It’s adorable, easy to clean, and my little girl seems very proud to sit on her own potty! Plus she gets a kick out of the flush sound it makes like moms toilet. Also you can put wet wipes in the compartment on top and they stay wet.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: ) The definite advantage of this potty is that it looks like a miniature of a real toilet
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps, this is the cutest looking potty:) The definite advantage of this potty is that it looks like a miniature of a real toilet, so very young children can at least, identify it's purpose, and unalike other potties, they are not confused to think that its sort of a toy or a chair. For me the only downturn is the size of the wipes/books section which is extremely small but could have easily been designed to be bigger as there is lots of space inside that just goes unused. Still, I give it 5 stars, as I think it's a perfect point to start potty training, which is what I've bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: Zatiki

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mini potty for potty introduction & learning!
customer_reviews.text: We get so many compliments on how cute this potty is! I love it and I love that it flushes. It is annoying that the tank lid comes off so easily so my daughter is constantly taking it off and carrying it and the flusher around lol but there's nothing faulty about this product and I would most definitely purchase it again! Oh, I will add that my daughter is only one and we are working on elimination communication so as you can see in the picture her feet barely touch. I slide a book under them typically but most children potty training are much bigger than my 14 month old so I'd assume that wouldn't be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: AuthenticallyT

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just got the item and as soon I opened it the box reeks of poo!! Yes! Ew! It seems that the item was already used before and then return. Clearly the person that returned it had use it and didn’t have the delicacy to clean it and Disinfectant! Gross! The the front part of the toilet had a bit of it on the blow and so did the instruction paper. The bad odor concentrated inside the box because there was no air. When I opened it the poo small blow up and my entire living room smells like it. How can anyone allow this to be send out to another child? Wow.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Peralta

customer_reviews.title: Great for stubburn potty trainers.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my granddaughter who at 2 was not interested in potty training. First day she got it she loved playing with it. Toilet seat lifts up and down and flush lever works to produce a sound exactly like it is flushing. By second day she walked over to it. We thought she was going to play. Nope. She took off her diaper and peed in it. She was super proud. Within a week she was so proud that she was doing so well. She was potty trained that quick.
customer_reviews.author: Me_So_Honey

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.text: Great realistic toilet. We went with this potty because it looks like an actual toilet so it made my son want to use it more. He has a matching toilet as mommy and daddy so that made him happy. It’s the perfect size for our three year old. I love how the back comes off of it to store books/games. We keep a tablet in there, and he plays that while he uses the toilet, and puts it back when his potty time is up!
customer_reviews.author: Katelynn Miller

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings - probably better for girls
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this for months and my son still doesn’t seem quite ready to train just yet, but I’ll give it a review thus far. My son is 2 1/4 yo and he has enjoyed playing with the flushing sound lever. We try to go before bath time and the splash guard is definitely a MUST to use. It’s hard to clip on though and I feel like I have to hold it in place while he’s going. He’s not comfortable on his potty yet. I’m not sure if he will be unless I can figure out the guard issue. I think this design would be better for girls.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary & Jaclyn Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Works well for a boy
customer_reviews.text: This potty works great with a boy. We previously purchased a different potty and the hole was just not meant for a boy. This hole is big enough and the splash guard high enough to not worry as much that he won't make it in the potty. We have to help him spread his legs but don't worry otherwise. He likes to flush it since it makes the flush sound and I like that it looks like a real potty. We haven't used the back area where wipes are supposed to go but it looks pretty small.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No clip on splash guard
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this specifically for the taller clip on splash guard for my grandson who will be visiting. I ordered in time for his visit. When it arrived there was not a clip on splash guard. Description and photos show a clip on splash guard is included with My Size Potty. I called the manufacturer who assured me they all had a clip on splash guard although it was not listed with components. They were willing to ship the splash guard standard shipping which will take one week. My grandson will only be here on week so it will not help for this visit.
customer_reviews.author: SMil

customer_reviews.title: Nice little potty, looks just like real toilet!
customer_reviews.text: I love that this looks just like our toilet. Super cute design, the flush sound is great. My only complaints are: the wipe container at the top doesn’t fit any wipes! The ones we have are too big, it says “travel size wipes” will fit. I scoured the store and all I could find was “travel size” wipes exactly the same as regular just in a smaller package. They still don’t fit. Also, the potty slides around on the floor when she goes to sit. We have linoleum in the bathroom. I ended up putting a folded towel under it and that seems to help. Would have been nice to have some kind of non-slip bottom.
customer_reviews.author: PrincessMom

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for boys!
customer_reviews.text: My son will not use Any other toy except for this one. That’s my only concern about him now been almost potty trained. He does not want to use any other toilet that’s bigger than the one he has at home, this one. Otherwise we love it to death. Any other toilet except for this one feels so big to him and scares him. That’s my only concern about him now being almost potty trained. He does not want to use any other toilet that’s any bigger or different than the one he has at home, (this one.)
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Nicole Kamstra

customer_reviews.title: just what i wanted... a training toilet, not a toy
customer_reviews.text: i can't understand how anyone can expect a toddler to learn on a colorful flashy training toilet... they look like toys! but this is PERFECT. it is an exact replica of a real toilet, no happy faces, bright colors or other silly crap on it. just a plain ol' toilet. perfect. my daughter can focus on training and not playing with it like a dang toy. of course the audible flusher feature is probably pretty fun for her to play with but at least it is exactly like a real toilet thats what we need not a toy
customer_reviews.author: Miss Erin Faye

customer_reviews.title: A few flaws, but cute
customer_reviews.text: The flip-top storage is completely useless. The fact that the water tank opens doesn't help me at all; in fact, my son just lifts it up and plays with it while sitting on the potty. I will likely super glue the water tank shut. The splash guard comes off CONSTANTLY (probably needs superglue, too), and I think it's too wide. When I take my son off of the toilet he has indentations on his inner thighs from the splash guard. All of that said, I like that it looks like a real toilet and the commode portion is easy to clean, especially if you line it with a small trash bag.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: Best Toilet Learning Potty
customer_reviews.text: We've tried two other kinds of mini potties for our LO before we tried this one, we should have gotten this one first to avoid the headache of figuring out why LO wasn't interested in using the other potties. The handle makes a flushing sound and the unit looks just like an adult sized toilet which makes our LO feel like it isn't a "special" potty (Yay for FOMO). The only ding is that the splash guard is hard to clean because of the nooks and crannies and how it is attached to the seat. So far, the best way I've found to clean it is to wash it unassembled in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Appleberry

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is an anxious and stubborn kid, no amount of bribes candy or stickers work with her. This is our 4th type of potty we've tried (starting to get expensive here) but the flushing sound and that it looks just like mommys toilet is big motivator. First night so far she sat on it no diaper and pushed and tooted! This may not sound like much but at almost 4 years old we were getting desperate. I am hoping this trend continues she didn't go but was very proud and excited that she could sit on it and loves flushing it. She even said she would try again tomorrow!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Good, would buy again
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this way more than his other potty. That it looks like a real potty and flushes really encourages him to use. Due to its shape and how light it is, I was worried my boy would tip it over while getting on and off, but the base perfectly fit two dumbbells to secure it, which I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria M

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner potty... even has a flushing sound... highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Okay.. this is awesome and I love that it resembles a real potty (but smaller version). It has no suction power you have to empty it manually (but I knew that). It is a good size, light weight and easy to clean. The only thing I don't love is the top part comes off and I wish it didn't... b/c the baby keeps taking it off (not a big deal though). It does make a flushing sound too! Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: baby momma knows

customer_reviews.title: Small seat but perfect for a girl
customer_reviews.text: Cute, sturdy, easy to assemble. I think I will be returning just because the seat space is small. Perfect for a girl, but the pee shield is pushing against his thing. Actually looking at the pic advertised I didn't get the same product.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: STELLAR
customer_reviews.text: Finally a Winkie guard tall enough. Granted if he has a little bit of 'wood' LOL it will splatter up on his legs. We purchased a really aesthetically pleasing potty chair prior to this one that is very nice but we weren't having any luck at all getting his interest and it needed to have a higher pee guard. He absolutely loves the Flushing noise. My husband wanted to buy one of these back when I was pregnant and I rolled my eyes. Guess what.... I would have saved money because I wouldn't have bought the other one in between. This one time I'll admit he was right.
customer_reviews.author: G. Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Great little potty!
customer_reviews.text: What a great idea! Make a potty that looks like a big potty! We decorated ours with stickers so my daughter felt it was hers. There is a little compartment on the top of the “tank” where you can store toilet paper and has a handle that makes the sound of flushing a toilet which isn’t too loud. The seat comes up and you can take out the bowl very easily. It is made of thick plastic and very lightweight. You could travel with it but it doesn’t fold up or get smaller.
customer_reviews.author: ACP

customer_reviews.title: Cute but not practical
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bc it is adorable and it looks like our toilets so i thought my 2 yr old would get the idea quicker and transition easier to a big toilet. There are a few issues with it being practical though. As a boy, he has a hard time sitting on it with the pee guard attached as it catches his little boy parts unless he straddles it from the side. It is not compact or able to travel so it will sit in a corner of your house somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keep it simple parents
customer_reviews.text: We loved this for potty training. It’s currently in my Chevy equinox. It fits perfectly for traveling and it’s easy to clean. I love that the only “fluff” is that it makes a flushing sound. But honestly I think it was smart to do that because many kids usually fear the flush. Not my kid though! I loved that it was realistic looking. It made it easy for her to use her tiny potty and a normal one. This toilet paired nicely with oh crap potty training book btw..
customer_reviews.author: Butler family

customer_reviews.title: Okay but could use some improvement
customer_reviews.text: It's super cute and I love the flush sound. However it's much smaller than I had thought it would be. So make sure you actually read the measurements and not look at the picture like I did. Also the top lid part is funky and doesnt really stay on right. Would be better if it clicked into place or something so it wouldn't just fall off.... but my son does use it and likes sitting on it so that's a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Shelb

customer_reviews.title: Best Potty Training Potty
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Summer Infant My Size Potty. We have one down stairs and my daughter loves using it. She will not ask to go. She likes to do it on her own then come proudly tell us. She has not been trying to go at night so we got one for her room and now she is going most of the time at night. She still wakes me up but at least I see a end of the potty training tunnel. Also they are super easy to clean. I wash out the bowl every use and then clean the potty when I go to clean the restrooms. It is just like cleaning a regular potty.
customer_reviews.author: Crocker

customer_reviews.title: Really helped!
customer_reviews.text: Well....I was a bit skeptical about the price for a potty when there were a lot cheaper ones out there. However this REALLY helped with potty traning!!! Because of the look it was EASY for my toddler to know the use of it..and the back peice for holding books extra wipes etc it great for sitting back and extra support. I think it worked great and helped my little one potty training a lot faster
customer_reviews.author: Josiah B

customer_reviews.title: A potty just for her/him
customer_reviews.text: My daughter absolutely loved this. She no longer uses it as she is fully potty trained, but when we got it, she immediately wanted to use it. She loved that she had her very own potty, and liked the flushing sound when the lever was pulled. I found it easy to clean; just remove the bowl insert, empty into the toilet, and wash. The wipes holder on the "tank" part is perfect. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Qubit

customer_reviews.title: Potty is a Potty and not a toy haha
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what to say, about how good is for my son, but this potty is bored for him. He knows, potty is for pop and pee, but he don't have any interest for potty training in this one. For me the potty is cool, because seems like an adult one, bored hahaha. The toilet sound works great, have space to save small trash bags and baby wipes! and it's sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Yan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect potty training seat for kids.
customer_reviews.text: The Summer My Size Potty is a perfect potty training seat for kids. It looks like a kids version on the big seat which helps kids feel like they have a similar seat to what adults use. It also makes the transition from kids to adult seat easy in the long run. The kids can both pee in it and go for potty. The simulated flush sound is also a exciting feature for the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Nav

customer_reviews.title: My son loved it. Your kid will too!
customer_reviews.text: Great little potty. Our son loved that it made the flush noise and that the seat went up and down just like the big potty. My only con to this is that when your have a boy and he super pees on the little shield part, that is tall enough btw, it somehow gets underneath the seat and can ever so slightly get on his pants. Idk of my kid is just a super pee’er or he’s sitting too close but I felt like I should mention it in case someone else has had that happen XD But even with that being said, I’d 10 out of 10 recommend for this big milestone.
customer_reviews.author: BatManion

customer_reviews.title: Toddler now wants to potty train
customer_reviews.text: My toddler was not fond of our high height toilets, even with insets and such. I bought this potty & she wants to use it all the time. It was very easy to assemble, just a regular phillips screwdriver and a small one. The flushing sound is fun & not overly loud. There is a little compartment on top-where a few wipes can fit in, but that is about it. It is easy to clean, just lift the seat-grab the bowl and take it to the toilet and dump in-I keep clorox wipes in the bathroom and just wipe it down and replace in her my size potty.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: A little too tall for my daughter right now, but will be great in the near future.
customer_reviews.text: I chose this product for my daughter due to it’s similarity to an actual toilet. I felt it might be easier to transition her to the actual toilet when the time comes. We’re not there yet, but I assume it will be helpful. The toilet itself is a little too tall for her right now, though. When she’s sitting on it, she’s only able to put the balls of her feet on the floor. If it was just a little shorter, I think we could be making progress with the potty training, but I can tell she doesn’t feel quite “safe” due to the height. My daughter is 2’6” if that helps anyone else.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Wiant

customer_reviews.title: Toddler loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome. A lot of our public toilets have mini toilets in and he loved the independence. We looked and decided this would be the best option. Set up was super easy and he was very excited. He proudly shows everyone his very own toilet. He isn't a little boy who was comfortable climing a step stool, so still relied on us helping him up. Now he takes hinselfnoffx pants down and away he goes. Number 1 or 2, he is happy. Incredible product.
customer_reviews.author: Louise

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this potty is great except the fact that even travel size wipes do not fit in the back well! Luckily wipes are always needed or I would have been highly upset going out of my way to buy wipes to fit! The spill guard barrier is awesome, let’s face it toddlers don’t always sit far back on the potty to not get pee everywhere!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Israel

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully those little hairs are eyelashes.
customer_reviews.text: Just received, not even a tinkie or tutoo yet. I will say I was surprised to see little hairs stuck to it right out of the box, probably not baby pubes (it’s both new and seemingly impossible), so I’m at a loss. I’m just going to clean it up rather than risk getting a dirtier one, which I read some horror stories in other reviews. It’s not very sturdy, a few spots for screws would help. It does look like a real big person potty so that’s why I went with it. I’m hopeful my daughter will do her thing bc it’s so “realistic” looking and she’s so interested when mommy goes potty. Lol Good luck potty training!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Jax

customer_reviews.title: Looks cool
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my daughter. She likes to press on that flush for the sound haha. Looks big on the picture but it's smaller than I thought it would be. My daughter is a year and 10 months old and it does feel like it's a little too small for her. I was hoping that the top cover part would fit those normal size wet tissue bags but you'll need to find a smaller bag or create your own way to put them in there.
customer_reviews.author: Chong Vang

customer_reviews.title: Excellent first potty
customer_reviews.text: Great potty. My son loves it. Good size for little boys to avoid pee outside the bowl both sitting and standing. It looks just like a real toilet. Only one drawback.... The top of the fake “tank” comes off which allows the inside of the “tank”, which is empty, to get dirty. It’s hard to clean. I believe the idea is that things like wipes can be stored in there but for us it’s just more of a nuisance. The top gets carried all over the house and the inside of the tank part collects dust and whatever else. I’m sure super gluing it together would solve the problem but I haven’t tried it.
customer_reviews.author: Momofboys

customer_reviews.title: So cute!
customer_reviews.text: This potty is super cute since it looks like a mini toilet! I think kids are more excited about this then other pottys because they are used to seeing a actual toilet so they think they are real big stuff when they use this. They only thing I would have to say about this is that I wish the top part was bigger where the wipes go, you have to cram them in there. Other then that it's a good one to choose.
customer_reviews.author: tip4

customer_reviews.title: Not for boys!
customer_reviews.text: Not for boys! This little toilet is adorable and my son loves it, buuuuuuuuttt, one minor (major) problem. The little pee guard does not work. It falls off all the time and when it doesn't fall off, my son takes it off to play with it. This would be great for girls but pass if you have a boy. My son has learned to point and now has some control when using it but it was messy for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: This trainer toilet is perfect. The toilet flusher makes an encouraging sound for my son. It's a reward if he goes in the potty! When he gets pee everywhere I can simply toss it in the tub and disinfect it. If he has a clean pee I can pull out the inner bowl and dump it in the toilet. There's a nice spout on the bowl making it easy to pour into the toilet. Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Alex & Candy

customer_reviews.title: P re
customer_reviews.text: My (just turned) 2 year-old daughter was afraid to sit on the big people potty, even with a seat cover. I didn't want her to be discouraged from training, so I bought this replica toilet. Wow. What a good decision. I assembled it and placed it in the bathroom adjacent to mommy's potty and she peed right away! She now goes in by herself, closes the door for privacy (haha) and a few minutes later I can hear her flushing. So darn cute. Perfect design!! 👌 Summer Infant
customer_reviews.author: D2

customer_reviews.title: Toddler loves to flush.  No interest in the business part.
customer_reviews.text: Worst purchase ever. 26-month-old loves to flush it. She says “want to go potty!” and flush. That’s it, just the flushing. She thinks she goes potty now. I’m going to see if I can get away with removing the top without frequent meltdowns. I already tossed the packaging, or I’d return it.
customer_reviews.author: RedWagon80

customer_reviews.title: Super Training potty, very realistic
customer_reviews.text: This is the absolutely best training potty. Soon, as it came in and we put together, my two year old grandson immediately started saying Pee-Pee. He recognized this as a potty, he has used it a few times now. Only had it for two days, and this should make transition to the regular potty much smoother when the time comes. He has to flush it too everytime he uses it. I have to say, it really does sound like a toilet flushing; LOL. I do wish the tank lid snapped on a bit better, it gets knock off pretty easy. All and all, I would recommend for anyone potty training a child.
customer_reviews.author: Ne-ne

customer_reviews.title: Catches pee, kinda small
customer_reviews.text: It seems small in all ways. Bought it for a 2 year old girl so she sits. If its for a boy whos may stand up you might not want this... The back isnt large enough for standard wipe containers so that stinks, the flushing sound is cute but that piece comes out. Easy to clean but havent had to deal with poop yet!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy/Ali R.

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a regular toilet and not too big or small.
customer_reviews.text: Cute potty. The top part that clips on doesn’t fit securely. If you can deal with that then the potty is perfect. I like that it makes a flushing sound. I like it because it helps my kid know that potty using is not a toy but a comfortable daily routine. I had a Minnie potty and my kid played with it and didn’t take me seriously.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed splash guard for boys
customer_reviews.text: Good for looking like a real toilet, or if you have a girl. But if you have a boy, the front splash guard does not stay on. My son pees on the floor unless I run to assist and hold it down for him. As soon as he get on by himself, it pops off into the toilet or the floor. I’ve taped it down, and it still comes off. Also, pee gets stuck in the tape, which makes its pointless to have on there. The splash guard needs to be redesigned.
customer_reviews.author: Gabby

customer_reviews.title: Great toilet! Just like the real one. Grandson loves it!!
customer_reviews.text: This potty is great! My grandson had a stroke in the womb..he is ready to train so I got him this toilet as it looks and sounds just like a real one! It makes it so easy for him to know he can go just like mom and dad do. He loves to hear the flush even if he doesn't go. It's really not a toilet to travel with. Personally I buy for everyone that will have him over. Consistency!
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Pribnow

customer_reviews.title: Great Potty
customer_reviews.text: We just got our potty and it's exactly what we were expecting. I wanted something more realistic as my daughter has a little fear of the big potty. I figured one her size would help her get use to it. We have yet to start potty training, but we're happy with our choice. The base is nice and wide so it's very sturdy. She loves the flushing noise, and I like that there's a spot to hold wipes. This was also about $10.00 cheaper than our local target.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Atchley

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good things!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this because it looks like a toliet. I had previously purchased a more “modern” potty, but my son wouldn’t sit on it. I thought purchasing one that looked like a toliet would help and it has. The only things I wish I could change is the top part (wipe holder/flush sound/nob) it easily comes off which distracts my very distractable toddler, but can easily be fixed with some tape or glue. You don’t need the wipe despenser or clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Summer Infant My Size Potty, White – Realistic Potty Training Toilet Looks and Feels Like an Adult Toilet – Easy to Empty and Clean
product_meta.description:
The Summer My Size Potty features the look and feel of an adult toilet to help ensure a comfortable and confident transition to the real thing. The toilet handle features a flushing sound to reward and encourage your little one, and a built in wipe dispenser promotes good hygiene habits. This easy to clean toddler toilet seat includes a removable bowl and an integrated splash guard for boys.

BRAND STORY
By Summer Infant
feature_bullets: REALISTIC DESIGN – The Summer My Size Potty is the original My Size Potty training toilet, and features a realistic design that looks and feels just like an adult toilet, ensuring a comfortable and confident transition to the real thing.
CONVENIENT TO USE – This potty training seat is easy for your little ones to use, and makes potty training mess-free. The built-in wipe compartment promotes healthy habits, too.
FLUSH SOUND – The handle in this training potty features a realistic flush sound to reward a job well done and encourage your little one!
EASY TO CLEAN - The My Size potty training toilet includes a flip-up lid and removable, easy clean bowl, making it easy to empty and clean. There’s also an integrated splash guard for boys.
FOR USE FOR – The My Size toddler potty is for use for children 18 months and up, and up to 50 lbs. Seating Area: 9.5 x 11.25 Inches; Interior Seat Opening: 4.5 x 6.25 Inches
